intro: Euphrasia brigantiaca, commonly known as the Alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Euphrasia brigantiaca is often found in open, sunny areas at high elevations.
